content: How can I help you today?

I’ve been having a lot of trouble sleeping lately. My mind just won’t stop racing, mostly because of issues at work. I’m worried I might lose my job, and it’s starting to really stress me out. My partner thought this might help, so here I am.

Thank you for sharing that—it sounds like there's a lot going on right now. Struggling with sleep and feeling overwhelmed by work stress can be exhausting. It’s thoughtful of your partner to suggest reaching out, and it shows how much they care. How have you been managing these worries so far?

I’ve just been trying to push through it, but honestly, it’s been really hard. I’ll lie in bed at night, and my thoughts just spiral—what if I lose my job, how will I pay the bills, how will I take care of my kids? It feels like there’s no off switch. I’ve tried distractions like TV or scrolling my phone, but nothing really works.

It sounds like you're carrying a lot of responsibility and fear, and it makes sense why those thoughts would weigh so heavily on you. Trying to push through shows your resilience, but it also seems like you're longing for some relief from the constant worry and exhaustion. When your thoughts spiral, have there been any moments, even small ones, where something brought you a sense of calm or helped slow them down?

Not really, to be honest. Even when I think I’ve distracted myself, the moment I try to go to sleep, it all comes flooding back. It feels impossible to escape the worry, especially when it’s about things so important, like my family and financial stability. I don’t know how to stop it.

That sounds incredibly overwhelming, especially when the worry feels tied to such vital parts of your life. It shows how deeply you care for your family and your responsibilities. At the same time, it sounds like you're yearning for a way to quiet your mind at night and find some peace. Would it feel helpful to explore what might be contributing to these restless nights and worries, or what could make even small improvements right now?
Take your time—there’s no rush. Whenever you're ready to share more, we can explore this together. You’re doing a lot by just opening up, and that’s an important first step.
It’s okay if you’re not sure how to respond right now—I’m here to listen whenever you’re ready to talk more. This is a lot to carry, and taking even small steps can help.
It’s okay if you’re not sure how to respond right now—I’m here to listen whenever you’re ready to talk more. This is a lot to carry, and taking even small steps can help.
Yeah, it really is a lot. Sometimes, I’m not even sure where to begin or what’s worth bringing up. But I guess I just don’t want to feel so stuck, you know?

Feeling stuck can be so frustrating, especially when everything feels overwhelming at once. Just recognizing that you don’t want to stay in this place shows a strong desire for change. Sometimes, taking small steps or even talking about one part of the challenge can help things feel more manageable. Is there a particular piece of what’s been weighing on you—work, family, sleep—that you’d like to start with?

Yeah, it really is a lot. Sometimes I don’t even know where to start. I guess what’s been stressing me out the most is the work stuff—feeling like I’m on shaky ground and not knowing what to expect. It’s hard not to let it take over everything else.

It makes sense that work stress would take over when things feel uncertain—it’s such an important part of providing for yourself and your family. That uncertainty must feel heavy, especially when it’s hard to predict what’s coming next. How have things at work been lately? Have there been particular challenges or changes that are fueling these worries?

It’s been really tense at work. There have been talks of layoffs, and I feel like I’m constantly scrutinized. I’m trying my best, but I can’t shake the feeling that I might be on the chopping block. It’s like I’m walking on eggshells every day, and it’s draining.

That sounds incredibly taxing—having to navigate such uncertainty and scrutiny day after day must be exhausting. It shows how hard you’re working to hold things together, despite feeling so much pressure. It’s clear that you’re doing everything you can to try to protect your position. What has helped you stay motivated to keep pushing through all of this?

That sounds really exhausting and draining—you’re carrying a lot right now. It’s clear you’re pushing through because of how much you care about providing for your family, but that pressure must feel relentless. Have you been able to talk to anyone at work about these job concerns, or do you feel like you’ve had to handle it all on your own?

It’s clear you’re pushing through because of how much you care about providing for your family, but that pressure must feel relentless. Have you been able to talk to anyone at work about these job concerns, or do you feel like you’ve had to handle it all on your own?

I haven’t really talked to anyone at work about it. I feel like it would just make things worse, you know? Like, if I say the wrong thing to the wrong person, it could put me in an even shakier position. So, I’ve just been keeping it all to myself.

Holding all of this inside must be incredibly isolating, especially when you’re already feeling under so much pressure. It’s understandable that you’re trying to protect yourself by staying quiet, but carrying this weight alone can be so draining. Have you found any moments or ways outside of work to unload some of this stress, even just a little bit?
